original_title: Aşk, Ateş ve Anarşi Günleri: Türk Sinemateki ve Onat Kutlar
overview: In 1961, the young writer Onat Kutlar goes to Paris to study philosophy. After discovering his passion for cinema at the Cinémathèque Française he decides to found a Cinematheque in Istanbul to bring the world of art cinema to Turkey. Although the Turkish Sinematek came to a tragic end in 1980, it quickly established an intellectual film culture that continues to influence Turkey today.
title: Days of Fire, Love and Anarchy
